params.pubkey: The pubkey of the validator to be boosted.
params.user: The address of the user boosting.

returns._0: bool False if amount is zero or if enough time has not passed, otherwise true.

approve(address,uint256).details: Only allows approve if the caller is an approved sender.

params.account: The address of the account boosting.

burnExceedingReserves().details: Since CL at deployment is minting to this contract a quantity of native token sufficient to redeem the upper bound of BGT production range, this contract may hold excess BERA. Can burn BERA exceeding BGT.totalSupply() + outstanding rewards.

cancelBoost(bytes,uint128).details: Reverts if `msg.sender` does not have enough queued balance to cover amount.

params.amount: The amount of BGT to remove from the queued boost.
params.pubkey: The pubkey of the validator to cancel boost for.

params.amount: The amount of BGT to remove from the queued drop boost.
params.pubkey: The pubkey of the validator to cancel drop boost for.

clock().details: Clock used for flagging checkpoints. Can be overridden to implement timestamp based checkpoints (and voting).

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

delegate(address).details: Delegates votes from the sender to `delegatee`.

delegates(address).details: Returns the delegate that `account` has chosen.

params.pubkey: The pubkey of the validator to remove boost from.
params.user: The address of the user to drop boost from.

returns._0: bool False if amount is zero or if enough time has not passed, otherwise true.

eip712Domain().details: returns the fields and values that describe the domain separator used by this contract for EIP-712 signature.

getPastTotalSupply(uint256).details: Returns the total supply of votes available at a specific moment in the past. If the `clock()` is configured to use block numbers, this will return the value at the end of the corresponding block. NOTE: This value is the sum of all available votes, which is not necessarily the sum of all delegated votes. Votes that have not been delegated are still part of total supply, even though they would not participate in a vote. Requirements: - `timepoint` must be in the past. If operating using block numbers, the block must be already mined.

getPastVotes(address,uint256).details: Returns the amount of votes that `account` had at a specific moment in the past. If the `clock()` is configured to use block numbers, this will return the value at the end of the corresponding block. Requirements: - `timepoint` must be in the past. If operating using block numbers, the block must be already mined.

getVotes(address).details: Returns the current amount of votes that `account` has.

initialize(address).details: Should be called only once by the deployer in the same transaction.Used instead of a constructor to make the `CREATE2` address independent of constructor arguments.

mint(address,uint256).details: This can only be called by the minter address, which is set by governance.

params.amount: The amount of BGT to mint.

minter().details: This is going to be the BlockRewardController contract at first.

multicall(bytes[]).details: Apply `delegatecall` with the current contract to each calldata in `data`, and store the `abi.encode` formatted results of each `delegatecall` into `results`. If any of the `delegatecall`s reverts, the entire context is reverted, and the error is bubbled up. By default, this function directly returns the results and terminates the call context. If you need to add before and after actions to the multicall, please override this function.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

nonces(address).details: Returns the next unused nonce for an address.

normalizedBoost(bytes).details: Used by distributor get validator boost power.

params.pubkey: The pubkey of the boosted validator.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

queueBoost(bytes,uint128).details: Reverts if `msg.sender` does not have enough unboosted balance to cover amount.

params.amount: The amount of BGT to use for the queued boost.
params.pubkey: The pubkey of the validator to be boosted.

queueDropBoost(bytes,uint128).details: Reverts if `user` does not have enough boosted balance to cover amount.

params.amount: The amount of BGT to remove from the boost.
params.pubkey: The pubkey of the validator to remove boost from.

params.account: The address of the account boosting.

params.amount: The amount of BGT to redeem.
params.receiver: The receiver's address who will receive the native token.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._activateBoostDelay: The new delay for activating boosts.

setBgtTermsAndConditions(string).details: Only the owner can set the terms and conditions.

params._dropBoostDelay: The new delay for dropping boosts.

setMinter(address).details: This can only be called by the governance module.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Only allows transfer if the caller is an approved sender and has enough unboosted balance.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Only allows transferFrom if the from address is an approved sender and has enough unboosted balance.It spends the allowance of the caller.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

whitelistSender(address,bool).details: This can only be called by the governance module.BGT should be soul bound to EOAs and only transferable by approved senders.

params.approved: Whether the sender is approved or not.

activateBoost(address,bytes).notice: Boost the validator with an amount of BGT from `user`.

activateBoostDelay().notice: The block delay for activating boosts.

boosted(address,bytes).notice: The mapping of balances used to boost validator rewards by an account

boostedQueue(address,bytes).notice: The mapping of queued boosts on a validator by an account

boostees(bytes).notice: The mapping of boost balances for a validator

boosts(address).notice: Returns the amount of BGT used by an account for boosts.

burnExceedingReserves().notice: Burns the excess BERA held by this contract to redeem BGTs.

cancelBoost(bytes,uint128).notice: Cancels a queued boost of the validator removing an amount of BGT for `msg.sender`.

cancelDropBoost(bytes,uint128).notice: Cancels a queued drop boost of the validator removing an amount of BGT for sender.

dropBoost(address,bytes).notice: Drops an amount of BGT from an existing boost of validator by user.

dropBoostDelay().notice: The block delay for dropping boosts.

dropBoostQueue(address,bytes).notice: The mapping of queued drop boosts on a validator by an account

minter().notice: Public variable that represents the caller of the mint method.

normalizedBoost(bytes).notice: Returns the normalized boost power for the validator given outstanding boosts.

queueBoost(bytes,uint128).notice: Queues a new boost of the validator with an amount of BGT from `msg.sender`.

queueDropBoost(bytes,uint128).notice: Queues a drop boost of the validator removing an amount of BGT for sender.

queuedBoost(address).notice: Returns the amount of BGT queued up to be used by an account for boosts.

redeem(address,uint256).notice: Redeem the BGT token for the native token at a 1:1 rate.

setBgtTermsAndConditions(string).notice: Set the BGT terms and conditions.

setStaker(address).notice: Set the BGT staker contract address.

staker().notice: The BGTStaker contract address that we are using to stake and withdraw BGT.

totalBoosts().notice: Total amount of BGT used for validator boosts

unboostedBalanceOf(address).notice: Returns the unboosted balance of an account.

whitelistSender(address,bool).notice: Approve an address to send BGT or approve another address to transfer BGT from it.
